availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Fay (Allen County, Indiana, attorney and judge.)

body.p: Allen County, Indiana, attorney and judge. Suffolk County, New York, native. Married to Julia P. Paine Fay on June 20, 1849. Father of Willie Alfred Fay, Kate Buell Fay, and Julia P. Fay. Attorney in Fayette County, Indiana, in 1850. Attorney in Allen County, Indiana, in 1860. Employed Maria Carriage as a servant in Allen County in 1860. Judge pro tempore of the Allen County Circuit Court in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Fayette County, Connersville, p. 185A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Allen County, Wayne Township, p. 923.
Thomas B. Helm, History of Allen County, Indiana: with Illustrations and Biographical Sketches of Some of Its Prominent Men and Pioneers (Chicago: Kingman Brothers, 1880), pp. 130-1.
"James Albert Fay (1813-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial 111037523, accessed July 5, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111037523.
KYR-0001-006-0013.
